cab.content:
(This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.)
G.T. 3250
SECRET.
Operations.
From: General Delme Radcliffe, Italy.
To: C.I.G.S., War Office.
Handed in 1.0 a.m. 6.1.18.
Received 60 a.m.
10098 January 5th evening.
First Army. On day of January 4th enemy shelled Italian positions from Monte Trappola to bottom of Astico Valley. Appreciable artillery activity on 22nd and 20th Corps front especially from Costalunga to Col D'Astiago along the Melago Valley and in Chiama Valley. Some fire in nature of registration during afternoon on Italian positions on line Malga Zugna, Selleta, Pasubio Monte Maio Two deserters on 20th Corps front.
Third Army. Along whole front enemy artillery active. A few rounds of heavy field artillery on Spresiano.
Fourth Army. Enemy shelled Italian positions on Monte Solar?lo and Monte Valder-Grap; also harassing fire in Monte Asolone, Monte Grappa area.
Third Corps. During day January 4th, harassing fire on Italian positions between Monte Cristallo Sella Tonale and P. Lago, Scuro. Aerial activity. Enemy raided Bassano, Castelfranco, Monte Belluna and Mestre, dropping bombs; few victims and little damage.
